verses.kjv: Again in the ninth year, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.web: Again, in the ninth year, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, LORD’s word came to me, saying,
verses.ct: On the 10th day of the 10th month, in the 9th year, the word of the LORD came to me:

verses.kjv: Son of man, write thee the name of the day, even of this same day: the king of Babylon set himself against Jerusalem this same day.
verses.web: “Son of man, write the name of the day, this same day. The king of Babylon drew close to Jerusalem this same day.
verses.ct: "Son of man, write down today's date, because on this very day the king of Babylon has laid siege to Jerusalem."

verses.kjv: And utter a parable unto the rebellious house, and say unto them, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Set on a pot, set it on, and also pour water into it:
verses.web: Utter a parable to the rebellious house, and tell them, ‘The Lord LORD says, “Put the cauldron on the fire. Put it on, and also pour water into it.
verses.ct: Then tell a parable to this rebellious people. Say to them, 'This is what the Lord GOD says: Put a cooking pot on the fire. Set it on and pour water into it.

verses.kjv: Gather the pieces thereof into it, even every good piece, the thigh, and the shoulder; fill it with the choice bones.
verses.web: Gather its pieces into it, even every good piece: the thigh and the shoulder. Fill it with the choice bones.
verses.ct: Fill it with the best cuts of meat — the thigh and the shoulder — and pack it with the finest bones.

verses.kjv: Take the choice of the flock, and burn also the bones under it, and make it boil well, and let them seethe the bones of it therein.
verses.web: Take the choice of the flock, and also a pile of wood for the bones under the cauldron. Make it boil well. Yes, let its bones be boiled within it.”
verses.ct: Use the choicest animal from the flock. Pile wood beneath the pot for the bones, and bring it to a rolling boil. Let the bones cook right inside it.'

verses.kjv: Wherefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Woe to the bloody city, to the pot whose scum is therein, and whose scum is not gone out of it! bring it out piece by piece; let no lot fall upon it.
verses.web: “ ‘Therefore the Lord LORD says: “Woe to the bloody city, to the cauldron whose rust is in it, and whose rust hasn’t gone out of it! Take out of it piece after piece. No lot is fallen on it.
verses.ct: "So this is what the Lord GOD says: How terrible it will be for the city of bloodshed! She is like a pot caked with rust that can't be scraped clean. Pull out the meat piece by piece — don't bother choosing which piece comes first.

verses.kjv: For her blood is in the midst of her; she set it upon the top of a rock; she poured it not upon the ground, to cover it with dust;
verses.web: “ ‘ “For her blood is in the middle of her. She set it on the bare rock. She didn’t pour it on the ground, to cover it with dust.
verses.ct: The blood she shed is still right out in the open. She splashed it on bare rock instead of pouring it on the ground where dust could cover it.

verses.kjv: That it might cause fury to come up to take vengeance; I have set her blood upon the top of a rock, that it should not be covered.
verses.web: That it may cause wrath to come up to take vengeance, I have set her blood on the bare rock, that it should not be covered.”
verses.ct: To stir up my fury and bring vengeance, I have left her blood exposed on bare rock where it cannot be covered."

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Woe to the bloody city! I will even make the pile for fire great.
verses.web: “ ‘Therefore the Lord LORD says: “Woe to the bloody city! I also will make the pile great.
verses.ct: "So this is what the Lord GOD says: How terrible it will be for the city of bloodshed! I myself will pile the firewood high.

verses.kjv: Heap on wood, kindle the fire, consume the flesh, and spice it well, and let the bones be burned.
verses.web: Heap on the wood. Make the fire hot. Boil the meat well. Make the broth thick, and let the bones be burned.
verses.ct: Heap on the wood! Stoke the flames! Cook the meat thoroughly, thicken the broth, and let the bones char.

verses.kjv: Then set it empty upon the coals thereof, that the brass of it may be hot, and may burn, and that the filthiness of it may be molten in it, that the scum of it may be consumed.
verses.web: Then set it empty on its coals, that it may be hot, and its bronze may burn, and that its filthiness may be molten in it, that its rust may be consumed.
verses.ct: Then set the empty pot back on the coals until it glows red-hot, so the bronze itself burns and the filth baked into it melts away and the rust is consumed.

verses.kjv: She hath wearied herself with lies, and her great scum went not forth out of her: her scum shall be in the fire.
verses.web: She is weary with toil; yet her great rust, rust by fire, doesn’t leave her.
verses.ct: But all that effort is wasted — her thick rust won't come off, not even in the fire.

verses.kjv: In thy filthiness is lewdness: because I have purged thee, and thou wast not purged, thou shalt not be purged from thy filthiness any more, till I have caused my fury to rest upon thee.
verses.web: “ ‘ “In your filthiness is lewdness. Because I have cleansed you and you weren’t cleansed, you won’t be cleansed from your filthiness any more, until I have caused my wrath toward you to rest.
verses.ct: Your filthiness is your shameless wickedness. I tried to cleanse you, but you refused to be cleansed. So you will stay in your filth until I have fully poured out my fury on you.

verses.kjv: I the LORD have spoken it: it shall come to pass, and I will do it; I will not go back, neither will I spare, neither will I repent; according to thy ways, and according to thy doings, shall they judge thee, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.web: I, LORD, have spoken it. It will happen, and I will do it. I won’t go back. I won’t spare. I won’t repent. According to your ways, and according to your doings, they will judge you,” says the Lord LORD.’ ”
verses.ct: I, the LORD, have spoken. The time has come, and I will act. I won't hold back, I won't show pity, and I won't change my mind. You will be judged according to your ways and your actions," declares the Lord GOD.

verses.kjv: Also the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.web: Also LORD’s word came to me, saying,
verses.ct: Then the word of the LORD came to me:

verses.kjv: Son of man, behold, I take away from thee the desire of thine eyes with a stroke: yet neither shalt thou mourn nor weep, neither shall thy tears run down.
verses.web: “Son of man, behold, I will take away from you the desire of your eyes with a stroke: yet you shall neither mourn nor weep, neither shall your tears run down.
verses.ct: "Son of man, I am about to take away the person you love most — with a single blow. But you must not mourn or weep or shed any tears.

verses.kjv: Forbear to cry, make no mourning for the dead, bind the tire of thine head upon thee, and put on thy shoes upon thy feet, and cover not thy lips, and eat not the bread of men.
verses.web: Sigh, but not aloud. Make no mourning for the dead. Bind your headdress on you, and put your sandals on your feet. Don’t cover your lips, and don’t eat mourner’s bread.”
verses.ct: Groan quietly, but don't perform any mourning rituals for the dead. Keep your turban on your head and your sandals on your feet. Don't cover the lower part of your face, and don't eat the food that mourners eat."

verses.kjv: So I spake unto the people in the morning: and at even my wife died; and I did in the morning as I was commanded.
verses.web: So I spoke to the people in the morning; and at evening my wife died. So I did in the morning as I was commanded.
verses.ct: I spoke to the people that morning, and that evening my wife died. The next morning I did exactly as I had been commanded.

verses.kjv: And the people said unto me, Wilt thou not tell us what these things are to us, that thou doest so?
verses.web: The people asked me, “Won’t you tell us what these things are to us, that you do so?”
verses.ct: The people asked me, "Won't you explain what this means for us? Why are you acting this way?"

verses.kjv: Then I answered them, The word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.web: Then I said to them, “LORD’s word came to me, saying,
verses.ct: So I told them, "The word of the LORD came to me. He said:

verses.kjv: Speak unto the house of Israel, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I will profane my sanctuary, the excellency of your strength, the desire of your eyes, and that which your soul pitieth; and your sons and your daughters whom ye have left shall fall by the sword.
verses.web: ‘Speak to the house of Israel, “The Lord LORD says: ‘Behold, I will profane my sanctuary, the pride of your power, the desire of your eyes, and that which your soul pities; and your sons and your daughters whom you have left behind will fall by the sword.
verses.ct: 'Tell the people of Israel that the Lord GOD says this: I am about to desecrate my own sanctuary — the fortress you take such pride in, the place your eyes delight in, the place your soul treasures. And the sons and daughters you left behind in Jerusalem will be killed by the sword.

verses.kjv: And ye shall do as I have done: ye shall not cover your lips, nor eat the bread of men.
verses.web: You will do as I have done. You won’t cover your lips or eat mourner’s bread.
verses.ct: When that happens, you will do what I have done — you won't cover your faces in mourning or eat the food that mourners eat.

verses.kjv: And your tires shall be upon your heads, and your shoes upon your feet: ye shall not mourn nor weep; but ye shall pine away for your iniquities, and mourn one toward another.
verses.web: Your turbans will be on your heads, and your sandals on your feet. You won’t mourn or weep; but you will pine away in your iniquities, and moan one toward another.
verses.ct: You will keep your turbans on your heads and your sandals on your feet. You won't mourn or weep in the usual way. Instead, you will waste away because of your sins, groaning to one another.

verses.kjv: Thus Ezekiel is unto you a sign: according to all that he hath done shall ye do: and when this cometh, ye shall know that I am the Lord GOD.
verses.web: Thus Ezekiel will be a sign to you; according to all that he has done, you will do. When this comes, then you will know that I am the Lord LORD.’ ” ’ ”
verses.ct: Ezekiel will be a sign for you. When the time comes, you will do exactly what he has done. And then you will know that I am the Lord GOD.'"

verses.kjv: Also, thou son of man, shall it not be in the day when I take from them their strength, the joy of their glory, the desire of their eyes, and that whereupon they set their minds, their sons and their daughters,
verses.web: “You, son of man, shouldn’t it be in the day when I take from them their strength, the joy of their glory, the desire of their eyes, and that whereupon they set their heart, their sons and their daughters,
verses.ct: "And you, son of man — on the day I strip away their stronghold, their magnificent joy, the delight of their eyes, and the thing their hearts cling to most — their sons and their daughters —

verses.kjv: That he that escapeth in that day shall come unto thee, to cause thee to hear it with thine ears?
verses.web: that in that day he who escapes will come to you, to cause you to hear it with your ears?
verses.ct: on that day, a survivor will escape and come to you with the news, and you will hear it with your own ears.

verses.kjv: In that day shall thy mouth be opened to him which is escaped, and thou shalt speak, and be no more dumb: and thou shalt be a sign unto them; and they shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.web: In that day your mouth will be opened to him who has escaped, and you will speak, and be no more mute. So you will be a sign to them. Then they will know that I am LORD.”
verses.ct: On that day, your mouth will be opened and you will speak to the survivor. You will no longer be silent. You will be a sign to them, and they will know that I am the LORD."
